comment.author: 59315946@N00
comment._content: There's something so surreal about this picture, the war-bonds poster on the right and the children looking at the globe on the left. It's almost ominous.

comment.author: 41378066@N00
comment._content: "Daddy is somewhere in this vicinity, on a ship sailing east."

comment.author: 23256190@N08
comment._content: Wonder if this is a one room school house.  There seems to be a broad cross-section of ages of the children.

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This image has been used in the indicommons.org post First of The Commons, on the first anniversary of the Library of Congress and Flickr's pilot launch.

comment.author: 7621733@N02
comment._content: That War Bonds poster is strangely similar to a lot of Soviet propaganda in the Cold War era... hhmmmm.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a new group called Uncle Sam – The National Symbol of the United States, and we'd love to have this photograph added to the group!

comment.author: 47691521@N07
comment._content: Thanks for sharing this work with the Commons! We've used it in an illustration for opensource.com opensource.com/education/11/3/what-i-want-my-children-learn

comment.author: 31301237@N00
comment._content: The war bonds poster doesn't even look real.  Reminds me of buddy jesus a bit.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: The Library owns a copy of that poster. You can see the record for it at www.loc.gov/pictures/item/90712765/ .

comment.author: 34918130@N07
comment._content: In the old one room Country School the Teacher had to teach all eight grades.   There was no Kindergarten.   Sometimes there was only two precious children in the third Grade.  The Teacher back then had to teach all of them.  They were well trained .   Music Class was enjoyed by the entire School.   A Teacher back then had to be very Responsible.  Not like it is now.   Many Educators now days, can't even teach one Grade.     They complain and complain.   Look at the wages the Educators get today.   Back then the Teachers had little pay.    They even had to haul water to the School.  Outdoor toilets. Pot bellied stoves.   The Teacher even had to bring in the coal and wood.

comment.author: 78912708@N07
comment._content: I believe all the war powers used a similar theme in their propaganda posters. I know I've seen the like in British, Soviet and German posters.
